daedalusQuestions.question: Who was Daedalus in Greek mythology?
Who was the son of Daedalus?
What famous structure did Daedalus build for King Minos?
What was the purpose of the Labyrinth built by Daedalus?
How did Daedalus and Icarus escape from Crete?
options: B) With wings made of feathers and wax
D) With the help of Poseidon

daedalusQuestions.question: What happened to Icarus during their escape?
options: A) He flew safely to land
B) He was captured by guards
C) He fell into the sea and drowned
D) He turned into a bird

daedalusQuestions.question: Why did Icarus fall into the sea?
options: A) He was attacked by a bird
B) His wings were too heavy
C) He flew too close to the sun, melting the wax
D) He was pushed by Daedalus

daedalusQuestions.question: What sea is named after Icarus?
Which island did Daedalus flee to after escaping Crete?
Who was the ruler of Crete that imprisoned Daedalus?
Why was Daedalus imprisoned by King Minos?
options: B) He helped Theseus escape the Labyrinth
D) He tried to kill the Minotaur

daedalusQuestions.question: Who solved the Labyrinth with the help of Daedalus' invention?
What item did Daedalus suggest Theseus use to escape the Labyrinth?
Daedalus was known for being:
Daedalus warned Icarus not to fly too high or too low.
Daedalus killed his apprentice out of jealousy.
Daedalus created statues so lifelike they had to be chained down.
Daedalus invented the first ship in Greek mythology.
Daedalus was eventually forgiven by King Minos.
Daedalus was also known for his architectural work outside of Crete.
